prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: Me. What more can I say? This is my third year as a young (but skilled!) lawyer.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 3
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Maya's cousin, and channeling prodigy. She has amazingly powerful spiritual abilities.
Character 4
Name: Adrian Andrews
Description: Head of planning, promotion, and security of the Treasures of Kurain Exhibit.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Mask DeMasque
Description: A flashy thief who steals valuable works of art. Sends a calling card before a heist.
Character 7
Name: Luke Atmey
Description: An Ace Detective. Has great powers of deduction, yet rarely makes sense.
Character 8
Name: Ron DeLite
Description: A young man who turned himself in as Mask DeMasque. A bit of a pitiful guy.
Character 9
Name: Desiree DeLite
Description: Ron DeLite's wife. Seems to be a very friendly and out-going lady.
Character 10
Name: Larry Butz
Description: My friend. I've known this trouble magnet ever since grade school.
Character 11
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 12
Name: Kane Bullard
Description: CEO of KB Security. His body was found inside his safe.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts.
Evidence 2
Name: Treasure Exhibit Poster
Description: A poster for the Treasures of Kurain exhibit. Click here for details.
Evidence 3
Name: Ami Fey's Golden Statue
Description: A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Is holding the Shichishito. A statue of the founder of the Kurain Channeling Technique. Moved the night of the crime. Carried into the basement warehouse the day of the crime. Moved again that night.
Evidence 4
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, it looks like a plain old pot. One of the treasures of Kurain Village. Supposedly priceless, but has no monetary value. Found in the office of Luke Atmey. Has pink splotches all over it. Found in Atmey's Office. Covered in pink splotches, but it's the genuine article. Broken and repaired by Adrian 2 weeks ago, then replaced in its box. Kept out of sight.
Evidence 5
Name: DeMasque's Calling Card
Description: Sent before a heist, the emblem is top-secret. [info] 

To the Security at Lordly Tailor.

I will be coming to purloin the most
priceless work of art on display in
your "Treasures of Kurain" exhibit.

Take good care of the speckled urn, won't you...?

Yours truly,
Mask DeMasque
Pearl:
Um, these cute little pink splotches... They said that it's paint... And that they were put on the urn recently!
Evidence 6
Name: Shichishito
Description: A ceremonial sword held in the hand of Ami Fey's statue. Wasn't bent before the crime. DeMasque knocked Atmey out during the crime w/ a blow to the back of the head.
Evidence 7
Name: Camera Data
Description: The warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime.
Evidence 8
Name: Desirée's Letter
Description: Addressed to her husband Ron DeLite. Apparently contains something important.
Evidence 9
Name: Security Camera Photo
Description: Photo of storeroom entrance taken by the camera. Click here for details.
Evidence 10
Name: Blackmail Letter
Description: Written with a fountain pen. Found in Ron's room. [info] 

Blackmail Letter

If you don't want your true
identity revealed to the world,
come to KB security at 1:00 AM
on October 12th and bring
$50,000.

If you don't, I'll take that red diamond you received the other day instead. Found in Ron DeLite's room. Written by Bullard. Click here to read.
Evidence 11
Name: Ron's Wallet
Description: Found by Larry at his part-time security job's company building (night of the crime).
Evidence 12
Name: Key Card → CEO Office Key Card
Description: Found inside Ron's wallet. Apparently used for the building of his part-time job. Found in Ron's wallet. Opens the KB Security CEO's office. Leaves a record when used. Found in Ron's wallet. Used on October 12th, the night of the crime, at 1 AM.
Evidence 13
Name: Publicity Photo
Description: A shot of Mask DeMasque striking a pose. Click here for details.
Evidence 14
Name: DeMasque's Broach
Description: Found in the shadow of Ami Fey's statue. Looks like it was torn off of some clothing.
Evidence 15
Name: Kane's Autopsy Report
Description: Time of death: 10/12 at 1 AM. Cause: Cerebral hemorrhaging from blunt trauma to the head.
Evidence 16
Name: Newspaper Clipping
Description: An article on Mask DeMasque's first heist. [caption] The article is titled 'Stolen!? The Gem and the Thief.' An image of a blue jewel is shown. Mask DeMasque is standing and ruminating in an alley, back to the wall. Next to him is a guiard with a flashlight. There are some trash bags. About first heist. Guard in photo is Ron DeLite. Click here for details.
Evidence 17
Name: CEO Office Buzzer
Description: Connected to the basement Security Guard Office. There are no fingerprints on it.
Evidence 18
Name: Kane's List
Description: Found on a table at the crime scene. Click here for details.
Evidence 19
Name: Buzzer Record
Description: The buzzer went off once at 1:02 AM on October 12 in the CEO's office.
Evidence 20
Name: Ron's Testimony
Description: From DeMasque's 2nd heist on, he was stealing as directed by blackmail letters.
Evidence 21
Name: Urn Box
Description: A wooden box that had the Sacred Urn in it. Has pink paint stains on it.
Evidence 22
Name: Paint Marks
Description: Completely dry. The box of the Sacred Urn fits in the gap perfectly. When Adrian dropped the urn's box 2 weeks ago she also knocked over some paint.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I first received the request from Lordly Tailor about 20 days ago.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 1
Testimony: The urn was placed in a box, and Zvarri! It was then sent to the warehouse.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 2
Testimony: Hence, I was actually unable to see the urn for myself until the day of the crime...
Person: Atmey
Testimony 3
Testimony: I knew it was an extremely valuable treasure, so I sent my card 10 days beforehand.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 4
Testimony: I then handled security by myself to ensure that my crime would go smoothly!
Person: Atmey
Testimony 5
Testimony: At last, I held the urn in my hands for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th.
Person: Atmey

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Alright, let's try to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. So, I'm looking at the given characters, evidences, and testimonies. The goal is to find a pair where one piece of evidence supports something and the testimony contradicts it, or vice versa.

First, I'll go through each testimony and see what it's saying, then cross-reference with the evidence. Let's start with Testimony 5 from Atmey. He says, "At last, I held the urn in my hands for the first time at 1 AM on October 12th." So, he's claiming that he first held the urn at 1 AM on that night.

Now, looking at the evidence, I see that Evidence 7 is the Camera Data, which says the warehouse camera went off at around 1 AM on the night of the crime. That would be around the same time Atmey was handling the urn. But then there's Evidence 19, the Buzzer Record, which shows the CEO's office buzzer went off at 1:02 AM. This suggests that the main event happened a couple of minutes after 1 AM.

Wait, so if Atmey was handling the urn at 1 AM, but the buzzer went off at 1:02 AM, that means the theft or the incident happened a bit later than when Atmey first held the urn. That could mean that Atmey was there before the actual crime, which would contradict his testimony that he was handling the urn at 1 AM when the crime occurred.

Alternatively, maybe the Camera Data is referring to the same time as Atmey's testimony, but the Buzzer Record shows an event a couple of minutes later. That might mean that Atmey's timeline is off, or that the crime happened after he was there.

Also, looking at Testimony 5 again, Atmey says he held the urn at 1 AM, but the evidence suggests that the main event happened at 1:02 AM, which would be a few minutes later. That could mean that Atmey was present before the crime, which would make his testimony incorrect.

Additionally, looking at the Newspaper Clipping (Evidence 16), it mentions that Ron DeLite was the guard in the first heist. That ties Ron to being involved in previous heists, which might support that he's involved in the current crime as well, possibly as Mask DeMasque.

Putting this together, the Camera Data and Buzzer Record both point to the crime happening around 1:02 AM, which is after Atmey's claimed 1 AM handling of the urn. This suggests that Atmey's testimony might be misrepresenting the timeline of events, as the actual crime occurred a bit later than he stated.

So, the contradiction seems to be between Testimony 5 (Atemy's claim about holding the urn at 1 AM) and the evidence (Camera Data and Buzzer Record) indicating the crime happened at 1:02 AM. This discrepancy in the timeline would be a key point of contradiction.
</think>

Testimonies:
Testimony 0

Person: Atmey
Testimony 1
Testimony: Kane Bullard decided to investigate Mask DeMasque and simply mistook who he was!
Person: Atmey
Testimony 2
Testimony: It was Mr. Bullard who wrote the blackmail letter and sent it to Ron DeLite.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 3
Testimony: And it was again Mr. Bullard who harbored a grudge against Mr. DeLite for his betrayal!
Person: Atmey
Testimony 4
Testimony: Mr. Bullard's mistake is quite excusable. The defendant truly believes he is Mask DeMasque.
Person: Atmey
Testimony 5
Testimony: That is why Mr. DeLite saw it fit to kill Kane Bullard. Truly a tragedy...
Person: Atmey

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, so I need to figure out which evidence and testimony contradict each other in this case. Let me start by looking at the testimonies and the evidence provided.

First, I see that there are five testimonies, all from Luke Atmey. Testimony 0 says that he had no points of contact with the victim, which I assume is Kane Bullard. Testimony 1 mentions that Kane Bullard decided to investigate Mask DeMasque and mistook him for someone else. Testimony 2 says it was Bullard who wrote the blackmail letter and sent it to Ron DeLite. Testimony 3 adds that Bullard harbored a grudge against DeLite for his betrayal. Testimony 4 states that Bullard's mistake is excusable and that DeLite truly believed he was Mask DeMasque. Testimony 5 ties it all together, saying that's why DeLite killed Bullard, making it a tragedy.

Now, looking at the evidence, especially the blackmail letter (Evidence 10), it's written by Bullard and sent to Ron DeLite. The letter threatens to reveal DeLite's identity if he doesn't bring $50,000 or take a red diamond instead. This matches Testimony 2, which states Bullard wrote the letter.

But wait, Testimony 5 says DeLite killed Bullard because he thought he was Mask DeMasque. However, the evidence shows that Bullard was actually the one who wrote the letter, which led to DeLite's actions. So there's a contradiction here. The testimony implies that DeLite thought Bullard was Mask DeMasque, but the evidence shows Bullard was just another person involved in the heist.

So, the conflicting pair is Testimony 5 and Evidence 10. Testimony 5 suggests that DeLite thought Bullard was the thief, but the evidence shows Bullard was the one sending the blackmail, not the thief. This means the testimony misrepresents Bullard's role, making them contradictory.
</think>
